question.body: What is the probability that only the dining room alarm rings? Pick the correct symbolic representation.

response.feedback: Incorrect. P(only D) is different from P(D) because P(D) includes the situation in which both alarms ring (dining room alarm rings and bedroom alarm rings). We want the probability that only the dining room alarm rings without the bedroom alarm.
Incorrect. P(not B) includes situations in which the dining room alarm rings and situations in which the dining room alarm does not ring.
Correct. If only the dining room alarm rings, then D and "not B" both occur.
Incorrect. We want the probability that only the dining room alarm rings. So the dining room alarm rings but the bedroom alarm does not.

part.hint: There is a difference between "the dining room alarm rings" and "only the dining room alarm rings."
If only the dining room alarm rings, then the dining room alarm rings and the bedroom alarm does not ring.
